1.text: And as Jesus passed by, he saw a man which was blind from his birth.

2.text: And his disciples asked him, saying, Master, who did sin, this man, or his parents, that he was born blind?

3.text: Jesus answered, Neither has this man sinned, nor his parents: but that the works of God should be made manifest in him.

4.text: I must work the works of him that sent me, while it is day: the night comes, when no man can work.

5.text: As long as I am in the world, I am the light of the world.

6.text: When he had thus spoken, he spat on the ground, and made clay of the spittle, and he anointed the eyes of the blind man with the clay,

7.text: And said to him, Go, wash in the pool of Siloam, (which is by interpretation, Sent.) He went his way therefore, and washed, and came seeing.

8.text: The neighbors therefore, and they which before had seen him that he was blind, said, Is not this he that sat and begged?

9.text: Some said, This is he: others said, He is like him: but he said, I am he.

10.text: Therefore said they to him, How were your eyes opened?

11.text: He answered and said, A man that is called Jesus made clay, and anointed my eyes, and said to me, Go to the pool of Siloam, and wash: and I went and washed, and I received sight.

12.text: Then said they to him, Where is he? He said, I know not.

13.text: They brought to the Pharisees him that aforetime was blind.

14.text: And it was the sabbath day when Jesus made the clay, and opened his eyes.

15.text: Then again the Pharisees also asked him how he had received his sight. He said to them, He put clay on my eyes, and I washed, and do see.

16.text: Therefore said some of the Pharisees, This man is not of God, because he keeps not the sabbath day. Others said, How can a man that is a sinner do such miracles? And there was a division among them.

17.text: They say to the blind man again, What say you of him, that he has opened your eyes? He said, He is a prophet.

18.text: But the Jews did not believe concerning him, that he had been blind, and received his sight, until they called the parents of him that had received his sight.

19.text: And they asked them, saying, Is this your son, who you say was born blind? how then does he now see?

20.text: His parents answered them and said, We know that this is our son, and that he was born blind:

21.text: But by what means he now sees, we know not; or who has opened his eyes, we know not: he is of age; ask him: he shall speak for himself.

22.text: These words spoke his parents, because they feared the Jews: for the Jews had agreed already, that if any man did confess that he was Christ, he should be put out of the synagogue.

23.text: Therefore said his parents, He is of age; ask him.

24.text: Then again called they the man that was blind, and said to him, Give God the praise: we know that this man is a sinner.

25.text: He answered and said, Whether he be a sinner or no, I know not: one thing I know, that, whereas I was blind, now I see.

26.text: Then said they to him again, What did he to you? how opened he your eyes?

27.text: He answered them, I have told you already, and you did not hear: why would you hear it again? will you also be his disciples?

28.text: Then they reviled him, and said, You are his disciple; but we are Mosesâ€™ disciples.

29.text: We know that God spoke to Moses: as for this fellow, we know not from where he is.

30.text: The man answered and said to them, Why herein is a marvelous thing, that you know not from where he is, and yet he has opened my eyes.

31.text: Now we know that God hears not sinners: but if any man be a worshipper of God, and does his will, him he hears.

32.text: Since the world began was it not heard that any man opened the eyes of one that was born blind.

33.text: If this man were not of God, he could do nothing.

34.text: They answered and said to him, You were altogether born in sins, and do you teach us? And they cast him out.

35.text: Jesus heard that they had cast him out; and when he had found him, he said to him, Do you believe on the Son of God?

36.text: He answered and said, Who is he, Lord, that I might believe on him?

37.text: And Jesus said to him, You have both seen him, and it is he that talks with you.

38.text: And he said, Lord, I believe. And he worshipped him.

39.text: And Jesus said, For judgment I am come into this world, that they which see not might see; and that they which see might be made blind.

40.text: And some of the Pharisees which were with him heard these words, and said to him, Are we blind also?

41.text: Jesus said to them, If you were blind, you should have no sin: but now you say, We see; therefore your sin remains.
